services.name: AI-Powered Talent Scout
services.overview: The AI-Powered Talent Scout is a comprehensive platform designed to revolutionize the talent discovery process for talent agencies, recruiters, and scouting teams. By leveraging advanced AI algorithms, the platform automates the identification of promising new talent across various online platforms, eliminating the inefficiencies and limitations of traditional scouting methods. The system crawls social media, portfolio sites, online communities, and other relevant sources to identify potential candidates based on a wide range of criteria, including skills, style, engagement metrics, and emerging trends. Machine learning models analyze these data points to predict future success and provide valuable insights into each candidate's potential. The platform offers a centralized hub for talent discovery, evaluation, and engagement, streamlining the entire scouting process and empowering agencies to access a wider pool of high-potential talent. Ultimately, the AI-Powered Talent Scout helps agencies reduce scouting costs, improve the quality of talent acquisition, and gain a competitive edge in the fast-paced entertainment industry.
problems_addressed: Difficulty in discovering emerging talent quickly and efficiently.
High costs associated with traditional scouting methods.
Limited access to a diverse and geographically dispersed talent pool.
Subjectivity and bias in the talent evaluation process.
Inability to identify talent with specific emerging skills or styles.
core_features: Automated Talent Discovery: Continuously crawls social media, portfolio sites, and online communities to identify potential talent based on predefined criteria and emerging trends.

AI-Driven Talent Evaluation: Employs machine learning models to analyze candidate profiles, predict future success, and provide comprehensive insights into each candidate's skills, style, and engagement metrics.

Customizable Search Filters: Allows users to define specific search criteria, including skills, experience, style, location, and engagement metrics, to identify talent that aligns with their specific needs.
Talent Profile Management: Provides a centralized hub for storing and managing candidate profiles, including contact information, portfolios, social media links, and evaluation scores.
Engagement Tracking and Analytics: Tracks candidate engagement across various online platforms and provides detailed analytics on their performance and potential.
Collaboration Tools: Enables seamless collaboration among scouting team members, allowing them to share candidate profiles, provide feedback, and track the progress of the scouting process.
user_journeys: A talent agent logs into the platform, defines search criteria for a rising animator with a unique style, reviews the AI-generated list of potential candidates, evaluates their portfolios and social media presence, and initiates contact with the most promising candidates for further evaluation and potential representation.
ai_capabilities: Natural Language Processing (NLP) to analyze candidate profiles and identify relevant skills and experience.
Machine Learning (ML) for predictive modeling of candidate success based on historical data and emerging trends.
Computer Vision (CV) to analyze visual content in candidate portfolios and identify unique styles and artistic abilities.
Recommendation Engine to suggest potential candidates based on user preferences and search history.
Sentiment Analysis to gauge public perception of candidates on social media and other online platforms.

Model selection notes: Utilize OpenAI's GPT models for NLP tasks, image embeddings from CLIP for style analysis, and a custom-trained regression model for predicting future success based on identified features. Vector search via Pinecone to efficiently match talent profiles based on skill embeddings.

input_data_types: Social media activity (posts, comments, likes, shares)
data_schema_recommendations: Candidates Table: candidate_id (UUID), full_name (TEXT), skills (TEXT[]), location (TEXT), portfolio_url (TEXT), social_media_links (JSONB), engagement_score (FLOAT), ai_evaluation_score (FLOAT), notes (TEXT), created_at (TIMESTAMP), updated_at (TIMESTAMP)
Jobs Table: job_id (UUID), job_title (TEXT), required_skills (TEXT[]), location (TEXT), salary_range (TEXT), description (TEXT), created_at (TIMESTAMP), updated_at (TIMESTAMP)
data_sources: Social media platforms (Twitter, Instagram, TikTok, LinkedIn)
data_requirements.privacy_and_compliance: Ensure compliance with GDPR, CCPA, and other relevant data privacy regulations. Obtain consent from candidates before collecting and processing their personal data. Implement data security measures to protect candidate information from unauthorized access or disclosure.

required_integrations: Social media APIs (Twitter API, Instagram API)
integration_plan.authentication_strategy: OAuth 2.0 for social media integrations. JWT for internal API authentication. Consider Clerk for comprehensive user management.

technical_specifications.architecture: The system will adopt a microservices architecture. It will include a frontend for user interaction, a backend API layer for handling requests, a database for storing talent profiles and other data, an AI pipeline for talent evaluation, and various integrations with external services.

recommended_tech_stack.frontend: Next.js 14 App Router, TailwindCSS, shadcn/ui, Vercel conventions
recommended_tech_stack.backend: Node.js / Next.js server actions / Vercel serverless functions
recommended_tech_stack.database: Planetscale / Supabase / PostgreSQL with schema notes (see data schema recommendations)
recommended_tech_stack.storage: Supabase storage / AWS S3 / Vercel Blob
recommended_tech_stack.AI: OpenAI API, embeddings, vector DB (Pinecone/Supabase vectors)
recommended_tech_stack.CI_CD: GitHub â†’ Vercel automatic deploy pipeline

API_design: GET /candidates: Retrieve a list of candidates based on search criteria.
POST /candidates: Create a new candidate profile.
GET /candidates/{candidate_id}: Retrieve a specific candidate profile by ID.
PUT /candidates/{candidate_id}: Update an existing candidate profile.
POST /candidates/{candidate_id}/evaluate: Evaluate a candidate using AI algorithms.
frontend_components: Candidate profile cards with key information and links to portfolio and social media.
Detailed candidate profile view with AI-driven evaluation scores and insights.
Collaboration tools for sharing candidate profiles and providing feedback.

deployment_instructions: Environment variables: OPENAI_API_KEY, DB_URL, SUPABASE_URL, SUPABASE_ANON_KEY, PINECORE_API_KEY, PINECORE_ENVIRONMENT
Vercel deployment: Connect GitHub repository to Vercel. Configure environment variables in Vercel settings. Enable automatic deployments on Git push.
Build outputs: Next.js static site for frontend, Node.js serverless functions for backend.

pricing_strategy: SaaS subscription tiers based on the number of users and the level of access to features.
Usage-based pricing based on the number of candidate profiles evaluated.
Add-ons for premium features such as custom AI models and dedicated support.

success_metrics: Number of new talent profiles identified per month.
Improvement in the quality of talent acquisition.
Conversion rate of identified talent to signed talent.
